original_solution_mapping.L1: Peter has read 8 of these books because 20 x .4 = <<20*.4=8>>8
original_solution_mapping.L2: His brother has read 2 of these books because 20 x .1 = <<20*.1=2>>2
original_solution_mapping.L3: Peter has read 6 more books than his brother because 8 - 2 = <<6=6>>6

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 6905.
    Returns: the difference in the number of books Peter has read compared to his brother.
    """
    # L1
    total_books = 20 # Peter has 20 books
    peter_read_percent_decimal = 0.4 # read 40% of them
    peter_books_read = total_books * peter_read_percent_decimal

    # L2
    brother_read_percent_decimal = 0.1 # brother has read 10% of them
    brother_books_read = total_books * brother_read_percent_decimal

    # L3
    difference_in_books_read = peter_books_read - brother_books_read

    # FA
    answer = difference_in_books_read
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Peter has read {peter_books_read} of these books because {total_books} x {peter_read_percent_decimal} = <<{total_books}*{peter_read_percent_decimal}={peter_books_read}>>{peter_books_read}

His brother has read {brother_books_read} of these books because {total_books} x {brother_read_percent_decimal} = <<{total_books}*{brother_read_percent_decimal}={brother_books_read}>>{brother_books_read}

Peter has read {difference_in_books_read} more books than his brother because {peter_books_read} - {brother_books_read} = <<{difference_in_books_read}={difference_in_books_read}>>{difference_in_books_read}

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: Peter has read 50 of these books because 20 x 0.4 = <<20*0.4=50>>50
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: His brother has read 2 of these books because 20 x 0.1 = <<20*0.1=2>>2
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: Peter has read 48 more books than his brother because 50 - 2 = <<48=48>>48

explanation: Incorrect operation. The calculation should use '*' but used '/' instead.
